answers.answer: Hi!Usually pain due to spondylosis is more common and evident in winter than in summers. However, the pain in muscles can also be due to dehydration and electrolyte imbalance if you drink less water in winters. Exposure to cold and hypothyroidism, and also diabetes can cause muscle aches in winter. Keep yourself warm and see if it helps. Other than this, please discuss these possibilities with your doctor. question: I have these sharp upper body muscle pains that only come on in the cold season and usually go away in summer. It is a sought of pulsating on and off pain that at times is unbearable throughout my upper body muscles. I have had this problem for the past couple of years.
title: Sharp pain in upper body muscles
